item.title: The Ten Truths
item.description:
entreaty: to ask (a person) earnestly and seriously (to do something)

Remember that

  • Humans are easy to fool (especially you).

  • Very few things are certain.

  • Science is the best tool we have for understanding the world.

  • The person who thinks he's not being fooled is the easiest person to fool.

  • The world is full of beautiful and interesting things and people.

  • You can eat, drink and be merry, but not so much if you have to get up and work in the morning.

  • Before your dad's sperm met your mom's egg, that's what death is like.

  • Today's authority is yesterday's snot-nosed kid.

  • All things are funny, in context.

  • The best answer is usually: I don't knowâ€”but maybe we can find out.

item.title: In the beginning
item.description:
“The church that teaches critical thinking.”

  • Belief in god is not the problem. Belief without evidence is the problem.

  • The more certain you are, the closer you are to the dangerous edge of orthodoxy.

  • When you think you have the truth, you stop looking. When you stop looking, you no longer see. It's best not to be blinded by complacency.
